body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated in preparatory school. Studied law and admitted to the bar. Practiced law in Elkton, Kentucky. Married to Emily Helm Bristow. Father of Mary Margaret Bristow, Margaret Mary Bristow, Benjamin Helm Bristow, and Frank H. Bristow. Elected as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1831 to 1833. Elected as a member of the Kentucky Senate in 1846. Served as a delegate to the Kentucky Constitution Convention in 1849. Served the Third Congressional District of Kentucky as Whig member of the United States House of Representative from December 1854 to March 1855. And again as an Opposition Party member from 1859 to 1861. Served as a member of the House Committee of Thirty-three in December 1860. Served as a member of the delegation to the 1861 Peace Convention in Washington, D.C. and the 1861 Border States convention in Frankfort, Ky.
